tit.j: 重要伝統的建造物群保存地区
tit.e: Preservation Districts for Groups of Important Historic Buildings
tit.cmt: 「用語集」とは異なりますが、「伝統的建造物群保存地区」と区別するためにimportantを追加しました。
tit.e: Preservation Districts for Groups of Important Historic Buildings
Preservation Districts for Groups of Important Historic Buildings

sen.j: 重要伝統的建造物群保存地区（じゅうようでんとうてきけんぞうぶつぐんほぞんちく）は、日本の文化財保護法第144条に基づき、市町村が条例等により決定した「伝統的建造物群保存地区」のうち、特に価値が高いものとして国（文部科学大臣）が選定したものを指す。
sen.e: The preservation districts for groups of important historic buildings refer to 'Historic Buildings Preservation Areas' ordained by local authorities under Article 144 of the Law for the Protection of Cultural Properties of Japan, of which the state (Minister of Education, Culture, Sports, Science and Technology) selects those which are especially important.

The preservation districts for groups of important historic buildings refer to 'Historic Buildings Preservation Areas' ordained by local authorities under Article 144 of the Law for the Protection of Cultural Properties of Japan, of which the state (Minister of Education, Culture, Sports, Science and Technology) selects those which are especially important.

The preservation districts for groups of important historic buildings refer to 'Historic Buildings Preservation Areas' ordained by local authorities under Article 144 of the Law for the Protection of Cultural Properties of Japan, of which the state (Minister of Education, Culture, Sports, Science and Technology) selects those which are especially important.

sen.j: 略して「重伝建地区（じゅうでんけんちく）」、または「重伝建」、「伝建」と称することが多い。
sen.e: They are often summarily referred to in Japanese as 'judenchiku,' 'judenken' or 'denken.'
They are often summarily referred to in Japanese as 'judenkenchiku,' 'judenken' or 'denken.'
They are often summarily referred to in Japanese as 'judenkenchiku,' 'judenken' or 'denken.'

tit.e: Summary
Summary
Summary

sen.j: 文化財保護法で言う「伝統的建造物群」とは、城下町、宿場町、門前町、寺内町、港町、農漁村などの、周囲の環境と一体をなして歴史的風致を形成している伝統的建造物群を指す。
sen.e: The Law for the Protection of Cultural Properties defines 'a group of historic buildings' as that which forms a historic landscape in unison with its surrounding environments such as towns formed around castles, posts (shukuba), Shinto shrines, Buddhist temples, ports, and/or farming or fishing villages.

The Law for the Protection of Cultural Properties defines 'a group of historic buildings' as that which forms a historic landscape in unison with its surrounding environments such as towns formed around castles, posts (shukuba), Shinto shrines, Buddhist temples, ports, and/or farming or fishing villages.

The Law for the Protection of Cultural Properties defines 'a group of historic buildings' as that which forms a historic landscape in unison with its surrounding environments such as towns formed around castles, posts (shukuba), Shinto shrines, Buddhist temples, ports, and/or farming or fishing villages.

sen.j: この制度は、文化財としての建造物を「点」（単体）ではなく「面」（群）で保存しようとするものである。
sen.e: This system is designed to preserve cultural property buildings in their 'aspect' (as a group) rather than as 'point' (individual entities).'
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: This system is designed to preserve cultural property buildings in their 'aspect' (as a group) rather than as 'point' (individual entities).'
This system is designed to preserve cultural property buildings in their 'aspect' (as a group) rather than as 'point' (individual entities).'

sen.j: 保存地区内では社寺、民家、蔵などの建築物はむろん、門、土塀、石垣、水路、墓などの「工作物」、庭園、生垣、樹木などの「環境物件」を特定している。
sen.e: In the preservation areas it specifies not only buildings such as temples, shrines, houses, or warehouses but also 'structures' including gates, mud and stone walls, canals, and tombs, as well as 'environmental properties' such as gardens, hedges and trees.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In the preservation areas it specifies not only buildings such as temples, shrines, houses, or warehouses but also 'structures' including gates, mud and stone walls, canals, and tombs, as well as 'environmental properties' such as gardens, hedges and trees.

In the preservation areas it specifies not only buildings such as temples, shrines, houses, or warehouses but also 'structures' including gates, mud and stone walls, canals, and tombs, as well as 'environmental properties' such as gardens, hedges and trees.

sen.j: 保存措置を図ることとされている。
sen.e: Once specified these areas are subject to preservation measures.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Once specified these areas are subject to preservation measures.
Once specified these areas are subject to preservation measures.

sen.j: 市町村は都市計画または条例により「伝統的建造物群保存地区」を定める。
sen.e: The local authorities determine 'preservation districts for groups of historic buildings' based on their city planning programs or ordinances.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The local authorities determine 'preservation districts for groups of historic buildings' based on their city planning programs or ordinances.
The local authorities determine 'preservation districts for groups of historic buildings' based on their city planning programs or ordinances.

sen.j: 文部科学大臣は市町村の申し出に基づき（「指定」ではなく）「選定」を行うこととされている。
sen.e: The Minister of Education, Culture, Sports, Science and Technology then 'selects' (rather than 'designates') those which are most important based on local authorities' recommendations.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The Minister of Education, Culture, Sports, Science and Technology then 'selects' (rather than 'designates') those which are most important based on local authorities' recommendations.
The Minister of Education, Culture, Sports, Science and Technology then 'selects' (rather than 'designates') those which are most important based on local authorities' recommendations.

sen.j: 2008年6月現在、日本全国で83地区が選定されている。
sen.e: In June 2008, 83 districts were selected across the country.
As of June 2008, 83 districts were selected across the country.
As of June 2008, 83 districts were selected across the country.

tit.e: Issues concerning the Preservation Districts for Groups of Important Historic Buildings
Issues concerning the Preservation Districts for Groups of Important Historic Buildings
Issues concerning the Preservation Districts for Groups of Important Historic Buildings

sen.j: 重伝建に選定される伝統的建造物群の中の道路形態は、自動車交通に対応していないところが多い。
sen.e: In many selected preservation districts for groups of important historic buildings, roads have not been made suitable for automobile traffic.
In many selected preservation districts for groups of important historic buildings, roads have not been made suitable for automobile traffic.
In many selected preservation districts for groups of important historic buildings, roads have not been made suitable for automobile traffic.

sen.j: これは、インフラ整備などによる開発から取り残されたり、元々交通の不便な島嶼や山間部にある集落で、産業が衰退したことなどにより結果的に伝統的な建造物が残ったところが多いためである。
sen.e: This is because most of the selected districts is located on islands or in mountainous regions which have been left out from the development of infrastructures and which have therefore remained inconvenient for traffic, resulting in the decline of local industries.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: This is because most of the selected districts are located on islands or in mountainous regions which have been left out from the development of infrastructures and which have therefore remained inconvenient for traffic, resulting in the decline of local industries.

This is because most of the selected districts are located on islands or in mountainous regions which have been left out from the development of infrastructures and which have therefore remained inconvenient for traffic, resulting in the decline of local industries.

sen.j: 重伝建選定時の伝統的建造物と都市計画道路との関係や、観光客の増加に伴う自動車交通への対応などが課題になることが多い。
sen.e: Many issues therefore have arisen as to the relationship between historic buildings and city planning roads, or the handling of automobile traffic caused by increasing tourists when a district is selected for national preservation.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Many issues therefore have arisen as to the relationship between historic buildings and city planning roads, or the handling of automobile traffic caused by increasing tourists when a district is selected for national preservation.

Many issues therefore have arisen as to the relationship between historic buildings and city planning roads, or the handling of automobile traffic caused by increasing tourists when a district is selected for national preservation.

sen.j: また、重伝建の選定は、建造物の増改築などに制約が掛かったりする。
sen.e: Likewise, once a districted is selected for national preservation, buildings in the district may be subject to constraints on extension or rebuilding.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Likewise, once a districted is selected for national preservation, buildings in the district may be subject to constraints on extension or rebuilding.
Likewise, once a districted is selected for national preservation, buildings in the district may be subject to constraints on extension or rebuilding.

sen.j: また、増加した観光客のマナー問題（騒音、ごみ、交通渋滞など）などによって、そこで生活する住民にとってマイナス要素となることがある。
sen.e: Unmannerly behaviours of increasing tourists (noises, rubbish, traffic jams, etc.) may become negative factors for those who live in the areas.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Unmannerly behaviours of increasing tourists (noises, rubbish, traffic jams, etc.) may become negative factors for those who live in the areas.
Unmannerly behaviours of increasing tourists (noises, rubbish, traffic jams, etc.) may become negative factors for those who live in the areas.

sen.j: 広島県福山市の鞆の浦では、市の「鞆港埋立による架橋計画と町並み保存は一体」との考えから、埋め立て架橋計画の白紙化と共に町並み保存計画も白紙化された。
sen.e: In Tomonoura, Fukuyama City, Hiroshima Prefecture, the local authority cancelled a plan for building a bridge by reclaiming the Tono port as well as a townscape preservation plan since it considered that the bridge construction over the reclaimed port was inseparable from the preservation of the townscape.'

In Tomonoura, Fukuyama City, Hiroshima Prefecture, the local authority cancelled a plan for building a bridge by reclaiming the Tono port as well as a townscape preservation plan since it considered that the bridge construction over the reclaimed port was inseparable from the preservation of the townscape.'

In Tomonoura, Fukuyama City, Hiroshima Prefecture, the local authority cancelled a plan for building a bridge by reclaiming the Tono port as well as a townscape preservation plan since it considered that the bridge construction over the reclaimed port was inseparable from the preservation of the townscape.'

sen.j: 重伝建の選定を望む住民などは、架橋計画とは切り離して町並み保存計画を進めるよう要望している。
sen.e: Inhabitants who want the area to be selected as nationally important historic buildings district urged the city to go ahead with the townscape preservation plan independently of the bridge construction plan.

Inhabitants who want the area to be selected as nationally important historic buildings district urged the city to go ahead with the townscape preservation plan independently of the bridge construction plan.

Inhabitants who want the area to be selected as nationally important historic buildings district urged the city to go ahead with the townscape preservation plan independently of the bridge construction plan.

sen.j: 重伝建の選定にあたっては行政と住民の協力が欠かせないものとなっている。
sen.e: Cooperation between the administration and inhabitants is essential when a historic buildings area is recommended as a preservation district for a group of important historic buildings.
Cooperation between the administration and inhabitants is essential when a historic buildings area is recommended as a preservation district for a group of important historic buildings.
Cooperation between the administration and inhabitants is essential when a historic buildings area is recommended as a preservation district for a group of important historic buildings.
